what: Calculate kinematic measures from trajectory data ‚Äî calculate_kinematics
title: Calculate kinematic measures from trajectory data ‚Äî calculate_kinematics
text: Computes translational rotational kinematic measures movement data. Handles data coordinate system automatically converting Cartesian calculations, converting back original system.

title: Calculate kinematic measures from trajectory data ‚Äî calculate_kinematics
Calculate kinematic measures from trajectory data ‚Äî calculate_kinematics
text: data aniframe position coordinates (x/y x/y/z Cartesian; rho/phi polar; rho/phi/z cylindrical; rho/phi/theta spherical) time column

title: Calculate kinematic measures from trajectory data ‚Äî calculate_kinematics
text: aniframe coordinate system input, added kinematic measures. 2D data, includes translational kinematics (velocity components, speed, acceleration, path length) rotational kinematics (heading, angular velocity, angular speed, angular acceleration). 3D data, includes translational kinematics (rotational measures 3D yet implemented).

title: Calculate kinematic measures from trajectory data ‚Äî calculate_kinematics
text: function preserves original coordinate system : Detecting input coordinate system metadata Converting Cartesian necessary Computing kinematics Cartesian space Converting back original coordinate system kinematic calculations performed using numerical differentiation via differentiate function. Angles unwrapped handle discontinuities ¬±œÄ.

title: Calculate kinematic measures from trajectory data ‚Äî calculate_kinematics
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # 2D Cartesian data traj_2d <- data.frame(time = 0:10, x = rnorm(11), y = rnorm(11)) |>   as_aniframe() kinematics_2d <- calculate_kinematics(traj_2d)  # Polar data (automatically converted and converted back) traj_polar <- aniframe::map_to_polar(traj_2d) kinematics_polar <- calculate_kinematics(traj_polar) } # }

title: Calculate rotational kinematics in 2D ‚Äî calculate_rotation_2d
text: Computes heading angles angular kinematics based velocity vector. Heading calculated atan2(v_y, v_x).

title: Calculate rotational kinematics in 2D ‚Äî calculate_rotation_2d
Calculate rotational kinematics in 2D ‚Äî calculate_rotation_2d
text: data aniframe v_x, v_y, time columns

title: Calculate rotational kinematics in 2D ‚Äî calculate_rotation_2d
text: aniframe added rotational kinematic columns

title: Calculate rotational kinematics in 3D ‚Äî calculate_rotation_3d
text: Computes 3D orientation angles angular kinematics based velocity vector. Uses spherical coordinates: azimuth (horizontal angle) elevation (vertical angle).

title: Calculate rotational kinematics in 3D ‚Äî calculate_rotation_3d
Calculate rotational kinematics in 3D ‚Äî calculate_rotation_3d
text: data aniframe v_x, v_y, v_z, time columns

title: Calculate rotational kinematics in 3D ‚Äî calculate_rotation_3d
text: aniframe added rotational kinematic columns

what: Calculate tortuosity metrics over sliding windows ‚Äî calculate_tortuosity
title: Calculate tortuosity metrics over sliding windows ‚Äî calculate_tortuosity
text: Computes multiple tortuosity metrics (straightness, sinuosity, E_max) sliding windows, returning value timepoint.

title: Calculate tortuosity metrics over sliding windows ‚Äî calculate_tortuosity
code: calculate_tortuosity(data, window_width = 11L)  calculate_tortuosity_2d(data, window_width = 11L)  calculate_tortuosity_3d(data, window_width = 11L)

title: Calculate tortuosity metrics over sliding windows ‚Äî calculate_tortuosity
text: data aniframe position coordinates time. Velocity heading columns computed already present. window_width Size sliding window (number observations). odd number >= 3 symmetric centering.

title: Calculate tortuosity metrics over sliding windows ‚Äî calculate_tortuosity
text: input aniframe additional columns: straightness Straightness index (D/L), ranges 0-1 sinuosity Corrected sinuosity index (Benhamou 2004) emax Maximum expected displacement (dimensionless)

title: Calculate tortuosity metrics over sliding windows ‚Äî calculate_tortuosity
text: required kinematic columns missing, function compute automatically calling appropriate helper functions. Straightness appropriate directed/goal-oriented movement, sinuosity E_max appropriate random search paths. 2D data, heading derived velocity vector, provides smoother estimates raw position differences. 3D data, turning angles computed angle consecutive velocity vectors using dot product. window centered timepoint. path edges, metrics computed available data within truncated window.

title: Calculate tortuosity metrics over sliding windows ‚Äî calculate_tortuosity
text: Batschelet, E. (1981). Circular statistics biology. Academic Press. Benhamou, S. (2004). reliably estimate tortuosity animal‚Äôs path: straightness, sinuosity, fractal dimension?. Journal Theoretical Biology, 229(2), 209-220. Cheung, ., Zhang, S., Stricker, C., & Srinivasan, M. V. (2007). Animal navigation: difficulty moving straight line. Biological Cybernetics, 97(1), 47-61.

title: Calculate tortuosity metrics over sliding windows ‚Äî calculate_tortuosity
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Kinematics computed automatically if missing data |>   calculate_tortuosity(window_width = 11)  # Or with kinematics already computed data |>   calculate_kinematics() |>   calculate_tortuosity(window_width = 11) } # }

title: Circular quantiles (Fisher & Lee 1995) ‚Äî circ_quantile
text: Returns angle Œ∏ proportion p data lie clockwise Œ∏.  algorithm works directly circle, immune artificial break 0/2œÄ affects simple rank‚Äëbased methods.  Consequently 0.5‚Äëquantile coincides circular median.

title: Compute centroid from keypoints ‚Äî compute_centroid
text: Calculates mean position selected keypoints time point. centroid computed combination grouping variables (individual, time, trial/session present).

title: Compute centroid from keypoints ‚Äî compute_centroid
code: compute_centroid(   data,   include_keypoints = NULL,   exclude_keypoints = NULL,   centroid_name = "centroid" )

title: Compute centroid from keypoints ‚Äî compute_centroid
text: data aniframe Cartesian coordinates (x, y, /z columns). include_keypoints Character vector keypoints include centroid calculation. NULL (default), keypoints used unless exclude_keypoints specified. Mutually exclusive exclude_keypoints. exclude_keypoints Character vector keypoints exclude centroid calculation. NULL (default), keypoints excluded. Mutually exclusive include_keypoints. centroid_name Name new centroid keypoint. Default "centroid".

title: Compute centroid from keypoints ‚Äî compute_centroid
text: aniframe containing centroid keypoint. Coordinate values mean selected keypoints (NA values removed). Confidence set NA. Missing coordinate dimensions return NA.

what: Compute numerical derivatives on possibly uneven grids ‚Äî compute_gradient
title: Compute numerical derivatives on possibly uneven grids ‚Äî compute_gradient
text: helper implements finite‚Äëdifference scheme based Fornberg formula interior points spacing coordinates non‚Äëuniform. End points use first‚Äëorder forward/backward differences.

what: Differentiate a numeric series (optionally repeatedly) ‚Äî differentiate
title: Differentiate a numeric series (optionally repeatedly) ‚Äî differentiate
text: Wrapper around compute_gradient() optionally applies gradient operator multiple times (order).  explicit time vector supplied, simple index sequence used.

Differentiate a numeric series (optionally repeatedly) ‚Äî differentiate
text: x Numeric vector observations. time Optional numeric vector timestamps.  Must length x.  NULL, seq_along(x) used. order Integer ‚â• 1 indicating many times differentiation applied.  Defaults single derivative.

title: Differentiate a numeric series (optionally repeatedly) ‚Äî differentiate
text: Numeric vector length x containing differentiated values.

title: Differentiate a numeric series (optionally repeatedly) ‚Äî differentiate
text: function computes first‚Äëorder derivative using Fornberg‚Äëbased scheme implemented compute_gradient().  order > 1, gradient applied iteratively result previous iteration.

title: Summarize keypoint data ‚Äî summarise_keypoints
text: Creates summary statistics across multiple keypoints time point. Currently supports computing centroids selected keypoints. Future functionality include polygonal summaries.

title: Summarize keypoint data ‚Äî summarise_keypoints
code: summarise_keypoints(   data,   keypoints = "all",   name = "centroid",   add_area = FALSE )

title: Summarize keypoint data ‚Äî summarise_keypoints
text: data aniframe containing keypoint data. keypoints Character vector keypoint names summarize, "" use keypoints data. Default "". name Character string name new summary keypoint. Default "centroid". add_area Logical indicating whether compute area (yet implemented). Default FALSE.

title: Summarize keypoint data ‚Äî summarise_keypoints
text: aniframe original data plus new summary keypoint.

title: Calculate summary statistics ‚Äî summarise_kinematics
text: Calculate summary statistics tracks, including translational kinematics, rotational kinematics, tortuosity metrics.

title: Calculate summary statistics ‚Äî summarise_kinematics
Calculate summary statistics ‚Äî summarise_kinematics
text: data kinematics aniframe (output calculate_kinematics()) measures Measures central tendency dispersion. Options "median_mad" (default) "mean_sd".

title: Calculate summary statistics ‚Äî summarise_kinematics
text: summarised data frame one row per group containing: Totals: total_path_length: Total distance traveled Tortuosity metrics: straightness: Ratio net displacement path length (0-1) sinuosity: Corrected sinuosity index (Benhamou 2004) emax: Maximum expected displacement (dimensionless) Central tendency dispersion (prefixed median_/mad_ mean_/sd_): Speed, acceleration Angular speed, velocity, acceleration (2D ) Heading (2D , using circular statistics)

title: Calculate summary statistics ‚Äî summarise_kinematics
text: Benhamou, S. (2004). reliably estimate tortuosity animal's path. Journal Theoretical Biology, 229(2), 209-220.
